France: Louis XII begins the Italian War of 1499–1504 in order to press his claims to the Duchy of Milan and the Kingdom of Naples.
Germany: Swabian War: A war between the Old Swiss Confederacy and the House of Habsburg took place in which the Swiss would win an exemption from paying taxes to the Holy Roman Empire and participating in the Imperial Diet.
Italy: The Italian War of 1499-1504, or Second Italian War, begins.
Spain: Italian War of 1499-1504: Ferdinand allied with the French King Louis XII of France.
